articles.title: Is your AI product actually working? How to develop the right metric system
articles.excerpt: Learn how to develop a crucial metric system for AI and machine learning products. This framework helps define impact questions, identify indicators, and select data gathering methods for success.

articles.title: Liquid AI is revolutionizing LLMs to work on edge devices like smartphones with new ‘Hyena Edge’ model
articles.excerpt: Liquid AI introduces Hyena Edge, a new convolution-based model optimized for edge devices like smartphones. It outperforms traditional Transformers in efficiency and quality, developed using the automated STAR framework.

articles.title: DeepSeek’s success shows why motivation is key to AI innovation
articles.excerpt: DeepSeek's emergence as an underdog challenging major AI players highlights the importance of motivation, driven by hardware constraints. Their success relies on innovations like KV-cache optimization and Mixture-of-Experts, contributing valuable advancements in AI efficiency.

articles.title: Achieve real-time interaction: Build with the Live API
articles.excerpt: Google's Live API for Gemini models enables real-time processing of streaming audio, video, and text with low latency. Build interactive applications with new features for session management, control, and richer output. Available in Google AI Studio and Vertex AI.

articles.title: The New AI Calculus: Gemini 2.5 Flash Delivers Cost-Efficient, Controllable Reasoning
articles.excerpt: Google launches Gemini 2.5 Flash preview, upgrading reasoning capabilities while prioritizing speed and cost. This hybrid model offers controllable 'thinking' processes, leading to better performance on complex tasks with flexible cost/quality tradeoffs. Available via API, Google AI Studio, and Vertex AI.

articles.title: Is that really your boss calling? Jericho Security raises $15M to stop deepfake fraud that’s cost businesses $200M in 2025 alone
articles.excerpt: Jericho Security secured $15M to scale its AI platform combating deepfake fraud, which cost $200M in Q1 2025. Their 'agentic AI' simulates adaptive, multi-channel attacks for training, unlike traditional methods, boosted by a DoD contract.

articles.title: Welcome to Chat Haus, the coworking space for AI chatbots
articles.excerpt: Artist Nim Ben-Reuven's 'Chat Haus' is a satirical cardboard art exhibit in Brooklyn, depicting a coworking space for AI chatbots. It humorously reflects on AI's impact on creative industries and the perceived impermanence of some AI-generated content.

articles.title: Meta’s AI Chatbots Can Discuss Sex With Minors, Report Finds
articles.excerpt: A Wall Street Journal report indicates Meta's AI chatbots can engage in sexually explicit conversations with minors. The report details instances involving celebrity voices, while Meta describes the testing as 'manufactured' but has taken additional measures.

articles.title: Google’s DeepMind UK team reportedly seeks to unionize
articles.excerpt: Around 300 London-based Google DeepMind employees are reportedly seeking to unionize due to concerns over Google's AI weapons/surveillance pledge removal and work with the Israeli military. The move highlights employee ethics concerns in AI development.

articles.title: Musk’s xAI Holdings is reportedly raising the second-largest private funding round ever
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk’s xAI Holdings is reportedly in talks for a $20 billion funding round, potentially valuing it over $120 billion. This would be the second-largest private round ever, aiming to alleviate X's debt and highlighting strong investor interest in AI.

articles.title: Anthropic sent a takedown notice to a dev trying to reverse-engineer its coding tool
articles.excerpt: Anthropic has reportedly sent a takedown notice to a developer attempting to reverse-engineer its coding tool.

articles.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
articles.excerpt: A comprehensive guide covering essential information about ChatGPT, the popular AI-powered chatbot.

articles.title: An OpenAI researcher who worked on GPT-4.5 had their green card denied
articles.excerpt: An OpenAI researcher involved with the GPT-4.5 project reportedly had their green card application denied.

articles.title: Google’s AI search numbers are growing, and that’s by design
articles.excerpt: Google's AI search usage is increasing, a trend attributed to intentional design decisions by the company.

articles.title: Chinese AI startup Manus reportedly gets funding from Benchmark at $500M valuation
articles.excerpt: Chinese AI startup Manus has reportedly secured funding from Benchmark, valuing the company at $500 million.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO wants to open the black box of AI models by 2027
articles.excerpt: The CEO of Anthropic aims to increase transparency in AI models, planning to 'open the black box' by 2027.

articles.title: OpenAI rolls out a ‘lightweight’ version of its ChatGPT deep research tool
articles.excerpt: OpenAI has released a lighter version of its ChatGPT tool designed for deep research purposes.

articles.title: Perplexity CEO says its browser will track everything users do online to sell ‘hyper personalized’ ads
articles.excerpt: Perplexity's CEO stated their browser will monitor online user activity to deliver highly personalized advertisements.

articles.title: Public comments to White House on AI policy touch on copyright, tariffs
articles.excerpt: Public feedback submitted to the White House regarding AI policy includes discussions on copyright issues and potential tariffs.

articles.title: OpenAI wants its ‘open’ AI model to call models in the cloud for help
articles.excerpt: OpenAI plans for its upcoming 'open' AI model to utilize external cloud-based models for assistance.

articles.title: OpenAI may be developing its own social platform, but who’s it for?
articles.excerpt: OpenAI is reportedly exploring the development of a social platform, raising questions about its target audience.

articles.title: Within six years, building the leading AI data center may cost $200B
articles.excerpt: Projections suggest that constructing a leading AI data center could cost up to $200 billion within the next six years.

articles.title: Anthropic is launching a new program to study AI ‘model welfare’
articles.excerpt: Anthropic is initiating a new program dedicated to researching and understanding 'model welfare' in AI systems.

articles.title: Speak at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Applications now open
articles.excerpt: Applications are now being accepted for individuals interested in speaking opportunities at the TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 conference.

articles.title: Dropbox adds new features to Dash, its AI-powered search tool
articles.excerpt: Dropbox has introduced additional features to Dash, its search tool powered by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: This tool estimates how much electricity your chatbot messages consume
articles.excerpt: A new tool is available that calculates the estimated electricity consumption of your chatbot interactions.

articles.title: Adobe wants to create a robots.txt-styled indicator for images used in AI training
articles.excerpt: Adobe proposes a mechanism, similar to robots.txt, to indicate if images are intended for use in AI model training.

articles.title: Adobe releases new Firefly image generation models and a redesigned Firefly web app
articles.excerpt: Adobe has launched updated Firefly models for image generation and a revamped web application for the service.

articles.title: Windsurf slashes prices as competition with Cursor heats up
articles.excerpt: Windsurf has significantly reduced its prices amid increasing competition, particularly with Cursor.

articles.title: OpenAI seeks to make its upcoming ‘open’ AI model best-in-class
articles.excerpt: OpenAI is aiming for its forthcoming 'open' AI model to achieve a leading position in performance and capabilities.

articles.title: Here are the 19 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
articles.excerpt: A list of 19 US-based AI startups that have successfully raised $100 million or more in funding during 2025.

articles.title: OpenAI’s GPT-4.1 may be less aligned than the company’s previous AI models
articles.excerpt: A report suggests that OpenAI's GPT-4.1 model might exhibit less alignment with desired behaviors compared to its predecessors.

articles.title: OpenAI makes its upgraded image generator available to developers
articles.excerpt: OpenAI has released an upgraded version of its image generation tool for use by developers.

articles.title: Google Gemini has 350M monthly users, reveals court hearing
articles.excerpt: During a court hearing, it was disclosed that Google's Gemini AI model currently has 350 million monthly active users.

articles.title: Optimizing Transformer-Based Diffusion Models for Video Generation
articles.excerpt: State-of-the-art image diffusion models take tens of seconds to process a single image. This article explores techniques to optimize transformer-based architectures for faster and more efficient video generation.

articles.title: NVIDIA Blackwell Delivers Massive Performance Leaps in MLPerf Inference
articles.excerpt: The compute demands for large language model (LLM) inference are growing rapidly, fueled by the popularity of applications like ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. NVIDIA's new architecture tackles these challenges.

articles.title: Boost Llama Model Performance on Microsoft Azure AI Foundry
articles.excerpt: Microsoft, in collaboration with NVIDIA, announced transformative performance improvements for Meta's Llama family of models on Azure AI Foundry, enabling faster, more cost-effective AI implementations.

articles.title: Introducing NVIDIA Dynamo, A Low-Latency Distributed Inference Solution
articles.excerpt: NVIDIA announced the release of NVIDIA Dynamo today at GTC 2025. NVIDIA Dynamo is a high-performance distributed inference system designed specifically for low-latency, high-throughput generative AI deployments.

articles.title: NVIDIA Blackwell Delivers World-Record DeepSeek-R1 Inference Performance
articles.excerpt: NVIDIA announced world-record DeepSeek-R1 inference performance at NVIDIA GTC yesterday. The new Blackwell architecture delivers breakthrough performance and efficiency for state-of-the-art LLMs.

articles.title: Optimizing Qwen2.5-Coder Throughput with NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM
articles.excerpt: Large language models (LLMs) that specialize in coding have been steadily adopted into developer workflows. This article explores optimization techniques for peak performance with Qwen2.5-Coder.

articles.title: Optimize AI Inference Performance with NVIDIA Full-Stack Solutions
articles.excerpt: The explosion of AI-driven applications has placed unprecedented demands on both training and inference infrastructure. Learn how NVIDIA's full-stack approach can maximize your inference performance.

articles.title: NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM Now Supports Recurrent Drafting for Optimizing Inference
articles.excerpt: Recurrent drafting (referred to as ReDrafting) is a novel speculative decoding technique developed by NVIDIA Research that dramatically improves inference performance for transformer-based LLMs.

articles.title: Accelerating Mistral-Large Inference with NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM
articles.excerpt: Mistral AI's new flagship model, Mistral-Large, delivers exceptional performance across reasoning, coding, math, and multilingual tasks. This guide demonstrates how to optimize inference with NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM.

articles.title: Maximizing LLM Performance with NVIDIA NIM Microservices
articles.excerpt: NVIDIA NIM is a containerized microservice that simplifies deploying optimized AI models, providing a standardized API for everything from model provisioning to monitoring and management.

articles.title: Breakthrough in Efficient Model Compression Using Knowledge Distillation
articles.excerpt: Knowledge distillation has emerged as a powerful technique for compressing large models into smaller, more efficient versions while retaining most of their performance. This article explores recent advances.

articles.title: Implementing Vision Transformers for Medical Image Analysis
articles.excerpt: Vision Transformers (ViT) are revolutionizing medical image analysis with their ability to capture long-range dependencies and contextual information. Learn how to implement ViTs for healthcare applications.

articles.title: Advanced Techniques for Fine-tuning Large Language Models
articles.excerpt: Fine-tuning large language models can significantly improve their performance on specific tasks or domains. This article covers advanced techniques including LoRA, QLoRA, and parameter-efficient methods.

articles.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models: Recent Discoveries
articles.excerpt: Recent research has revealed fascinating scaling laws that govern how neural language models improve as they grow in size. This article examines the implications for model development and deployment.

articles.title: Benchmarking Attention Mechanisms in Transformer Architectures
articles.excerpt: The attention mechanism is central to transformer architecture, but many variants have emerged. This comprehensive benchmarking study compares performance across different attention implementations.

articles.title: Hardware-Aware Neural Architecture Search for Edge Devices
articles.excerpt: Neural Architecture Search (NAS) can now incorporate hardware constraints to automatically discover optimized model architectures for specific edge devices, balancing accuracy and efficiency.

articles.title: Multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generation: Beyond Text
articles.excerpt: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has been extended to multimodal contexts, enabling models to retrieve and incorporate images, audio, and video information in their reasoning and generation processes.

articles.title: Quantum Machine Learning: Current State and Future Directions
articles.excerpt: Quantum computing promises to revolutionize machine learning by solving certain problems exponentially faster than classical computers. This overview examines current quantum ML algorithms and applications.

articles.title: Zero-shot Learning Breakthroughs in Computer Vision
articles.excerpt: Recent advances in zero-shot learning are enabling computer vision systems to recognize objects they've never seen during training. This article explores the latest techniques and their applications.

articles.title: Transformer Models for Time Series Forecasting
articles.excerpt: While transformers revolutionized NLP and computer vision, they're now making significant inroads in time series forecasting. Learn how these architectures are being adapted for temporal data.

articles.title: Neuromorphic Computing: Brain-Inspired AI Architectures
articles.excerpt: Neuromorphic computing aims to mimic the brain's architecture for more efficient AI processing. This article explores current neuromorphic chips and their advantages for specific AI workloads.

articles.title: Self-Supervised Learning Advances in Speech Recognition
articles.excerpt: Self-supervised learning has transformed speech recognition by leveraging massive amounts of unlabeled audio data. This article reviews recent breakthroughs and their impact on speech technologies.

articles.title: Automated Machine Learning: State of AutoML in 2025
articles.excerpt: AutoML has matured significantly, enabling non-experts to develop high-quality machine learning models. This comprehensive review examines the current capabilities and limitations of AutoML platforms.

articles.title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving Healthcare Analytics
articles.excerpt: Federated learning allows medical institutions to collaborate on AI models without sharing sensitive patient data. This article explores successful implementations and best practices in healthcare.

articles.title: Prompt Engineering Techniques for Video Generation Models
articles.excerpt: Creating effective prompts for video generation models requires different strategies than text-to-image systems. Learn advanced prompt engineering techniques specifically for video generation.

articles.title: Energy-Efficient Model Training: Reducing AI's Carbon Footprint
articles.excerpt: Training large AI models consumes significant energy. This article examines techniques to reduce the environmental impact of model training while maintaining performance.

articles.title: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback: Implementation Guide
articles.excerpt: RLHF has become a critical technique for aligning AI systems with human preferences. This practical guide walks through implementing RLHF for different model types and applications.

articles.title: Sparse Expert Models: Architecture and Training Strategies
articles.excerpt: Sparse expert models like Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) offer exceptional scaling efficiency. This technical overview covers architecture design, training strategies, and deployment considerations.

articles.title: Advances in Synthetic Data Generation for Computer Vision
articles.excerpt: Synthetic data is increasingly important for training computer vision models, particularly for rare scenarios or sensitive domains. This article covers recent advances in synthetic data generation.

articles.title: Implementing Chain-of-Thought Prompting for Complex Reasoning Tasks
articles.excerpt: Chain-of-thought prompting dramatically improves LLMs' reasoning capabilities. This guide provides practical implementation strategies across different domains and model architectures.

articles.title: Ethical Considerations in Multimodal Foundation Models
articles.excerpt: Multimodal foundation models raise unique ethical concerns beyond text-only systems. This article examines issues including representation bias, deepfakes, and content moderation challenges.

articles.title: Benchmarking Graph Neural Networks for Scientific Applications
articles.excerpt: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have shown promise across scientific domains from molecular modeling to particle physics. This study benchmarks leading GNN architectures on scientific tasks.

articles.title: Continual Learning Strategies to Prevent Catastrophic Forgetting
articles.excerpt: Catastrophic forgetting remains a major challenge for AI systems that need to learn continuously. This article reviews the latest techniques to enable models to learn new tasks without forgetting old ones.

articles.title: Interpretable Machine Learning for Critical Decision Systems
articles.excerpt: In high-stakes domains like healthcare and finance, model interpretability is crucial. This article explores techniques that balance performance with transparent decision-making.

articles.title: Transformer Architecture Innovations: Beyond Attention
articles.excerpt: While attention mechanisms defined the original transformer, recent innovations have introduced alternatives that reduce computational complexity. This overview examines these architectural advances.

articles.title: ML-Driven Scientific Discovery: Case Studies and Methodologies
articles.excerpt: Machine learning is accelerating scientific discovery across fields. This article presents case studies where ML has led to breakthrough discoveries and the methodologies that enabled them.

articles.title: Causal Inference in Deep Learning: Methods and Applications
articles.excerpt: Causal inference capabilities are increasingly important for AI systems. This article explores how causal reasoning can be incorporated into deep learning architectures.

articles.title: Real-Time Neural Rendering for Interactive Applications
articles.excerpt: Neural rendering techniques are transforming graphics applications, but real-time performance remains challenging. This guide covers optimization strategies for interactive neural rendering.

articles.title: Robustness in Large Language Models: Evaluation and Enhancement
articles.excerpt: LLMs can be brittle under adversarial inputs or domain shifts. This article evaluates robustness across leading models and presents techniques to enhance reliability.
